plants.name: Alocasia
plants.about: Arrow-shaped leaves, large ribs in white and silver over the intense and shiny metallic green.
plants.water_tips: Watering twice a week is usually enough. It loves the humidity of the air. Therefore, spray water on its leaves frequently.
plants.light_tips: It preferes airy places, which receive abundant light, but indirectly, and without the presence of drafty. The full sun can burn your leaves

plants.name: Aloe Vera
plants.about: Aloe vera is an easy, attractive and useful plant. Their leaves can be used to relieve pain from scrapes and burns when applied topically.
plants.water_tips: Water aloe vera plants deeply, but infrequently. Once a week is enough.
plants.light_tips: Place in bright, indirect sunlight or artificial light. Aloe that are kept in low light often grow leggy.

plants.name: Aningapara
plants.about: Its foliage is very ornamental, composed of large and shiny leaves, with streaky spots. It is a very toxic plant.
plants.water_tips: Regular watering is recommended to keep the soil moist, without soaking. Water twice a week.
plants.light_tips: Adapts well to half-shade or diffused light, making it a great plant to have indoors.

plants.name: Areca
plants.about: Areca is one of the most popular palm trees. In natural conditions, it can reach up to 9 meters.
plants.water_tips: Native to tropical forests, she likes humidity. Keep an eye out just to keep it from getting soaked, a condition in which it becomes an easy target for pests.
plants.light_tips: Half shade, full sun.

plants.name: Bamboo
plants.about: Luck, prosperity, togetherness. On land or in water, this plant brings the oriental tradition of harmonizing environments and good fluids. Very resistant and flexible.
plants.water_tips: Water three times per week. Give preference to the soft earth, keeping it always moist.
plants.light_tips: Half-shade. A corner with natural light away from the window, 3m away is enough for it to grow full of life.

plants.name: Basil
plants.about: Having a basil plant at home lets you enjoy all the freshness of a seasoned harvest and does not require much space for cultivation.
plants.water_tips: Keep the soil always moist, never soaked. Water it 3 times per week.
plants.light_tips: Full sun. If the corner chosen for your plant receives the strong midday sun, 3 hours of exposure is usually enough.

plants.name: Strelitzia
plants.about: Perennial herbaceous plant, produces flowers almost the whole year.
plants.water_tips: It likes water, but not soaked soil. Water twice a week.
plants.light_tips: It likes a lot of light, it should preferably be grown in full sun.

plants.name: Bromelia
plants.about: It's a type of tropical vegetation. It is known for the grouping of its rosette-shaped leaves and for its exotic look, full of colors.
plants.water_tips: Water twice a week. This species can withstand short periods of drought.
plants.light_tips: Half-shade. Enjoy the morning sun, before 10am, or the end of the day, after 4pm, so as not to burn the foliage.

plants.name: Cactus
plants.about: They survive in hot or arid places by accumulating water in their tissues
plants.water_tips: Once a week, in full sun, or every 10 days, in half-shade. Bet on the mixture of soil and sand to prevent rotting of the roots.
plants.light_tips: Full sun. This plant is also able to adapt to half-shade, although it will not offer its colorful exuberance.

plants.name: Coriander
plants.about: Coriander is originally from Asia and the Mediterranean. It's widely used in oriental and brazilian cuisine and in the preparation of fish and seafood.
plants.water_tips: Coriander likes slightly moistened soil, never dry or soaked. Water it 3 time per week.
plants.light_tips: In addition to enjoying the warmth, the coriander needs to be in direct sunlight for at least 4 hours a day.

plants.name: Ficus
plants.about: Native to West Africa, it is a species that in nature can begin life as an epiphyte, growing on other trees. But it can also be used as an ornamental plant indoors.
plants.water_tips: Water regularly - three times a week should be enough - in an abundant way and let the water drain through the entire pot so as not to rot the root.
plants.light_tips: It likes humid environments with a lot of light, but without direct sunlight - except in cases where the sprouting happened in direct sunlight and his plant is already rusting.

plants.name: Philodendron
plants.about: Brazilian from the Atlantic Forest, the Philodendron owns leaves that appear to have been cut by hand.
plants.water_tips: 2x a week. Keep the soil always moist, without soaking.
plants.light_tips: Full sun or half shade.

plants.name: Epipremnum
plants.about: Originally from the Solomon Islands, it has large, thick leaves and white or yellow spots when grown up. This plants filters impurities from the air.
plants.water_tips: Water 2 times a week, always remembering to check the soil before watering it again.
plants.light_tips: Half-shade and diffused light.

plants.name: Lavander
plants.about: Typical of the region from southern Europe to northern Africa, Arabia and the Canary Islands. Lavender is a plant with very fragrant flowers and can be used in many ways.
plants.water_tips: Water once a week.
plants.light_tips: Lavender loves the sun! So choose the sunniest place possible.

plants.name: Mint
plants.about: Mint is a perennial with very fragrant, toothed leaves and tiny purple, pink, or white flowers. It has a fruity, aromatic taste.
plants.water_tips: Water it 3 times per week to keep the soil evenly moist.
plants.light_tips: Mint performs its best in full sun, as long as the soil is kept moist, but it also thrives in partial shade.

plants.name: Monstera
plants.about: Old known from Central America, where it originated, this species reached other parts of the world in the early 20th century.
plants.water_tips: 3x per week. Keep the soil moist, never soaked.
plants.light_tips: Half shade or diffused light. Always protected from direct sunlight.

plants.name: Musa
plants.about: The Musa, also known as the banana tree, is native to Southeast Asia and Australia.  Nowadays, however, the plant is grown in many tropical countries.
plants.water_tips: The Musa itself already consists of 80% water and also needs a lot of water. Water 3  times a week.
plants.light_tips: The banana plant loves a lot of sunlight and is therefore also grown under filtered light.

plants.name: Parsley
plants.about: Parsley is a very commonly grown herb, used mainly as a garnish and to make delicious parsley sauce. But it is also an excellent ingredient for flavouring savoury dishes, making flavoured butter and stuffings and is very rich in vitamin C.
plants.water_tips: Parsley will need watering about 3 times per week. If it runs out of water, it will let you know by wilting.
plants.light_tips: It grows best in a sunny and they needs to receive six to eight hours of direct sunlight every day.

plants.name: Peperomia
plants.about: Belonging to the species of the Piperaceae family, it is perfect for those who like hanging plants. Has a beautiful light green heart-shaped leaves and whitish spots on the edges.
plants.water_tips: Watering can once a week, taking care not to soak the substrate. This can rot your roots.
plants.light_tips: It's recommend growing it in environments in half-shade or diffused light, since the direct sun can burn its leaves. It is also sensitive to frost.

plants.name: Sedum
plants.about: This succulent is a herbaceous native from Mexico whose main characteristic is the hanging branches.
plants.water_tips: 1x per week. Unlike other succulents, which tend to be watered more frequently and in a smaller volume.
plants.light_tips: Half shade or full sun. Leave your plant in a place that receives sun for at least 2 hours a day.

plants.name: Rosemary
plants.about: Rosemary is one of those wonderful herbs that makes a beautiful ornamental plant as well as a versatile culinary seasoning.
plants.water_tips: Water once a week. Be careful not to over-water and avoid making the soil soggy.
plants.light_tips: Give it six to eight hours of full sunlight each day.

plants.name: Fern
plants.about: It is one of the oldest plants in the world. As they do not produce seeds, their reproduction happens through spore.
plants.water_tips: The fern likes a lot of moisture, both in the leaves and in the soil.
plants.light_tips: Indirect light. Full sun can burn the leaves.

plants.name: Sansevieria
plants.about: It is used in many homes as a spiritual protector: some say that it is capable of cutting off negative energy and still scaring away evil spirits.
plants.water_tips: It is a species that can withstand periods of drought. Prefer to sin by the lack and not by the excess of water. In general, watering once a week is enough.
plants.light_tips: It adapts both in diffused light and in direct sunlight. The difference is in growth: the more sun, the faster it will develop.

plants.name: Sunflower
plants.about: The sunflower originates from North and South America, but also does very well in Europe and other temperate regions. A sunflower seed turns into a fabulous yellow sunflower in just a few months.
plants.water_tips: The plant needs a lot of water. The soil should always be a bit damp.
plants.light_tips: As the name suggests, the sunflower loves sunshine and can tolerate a lot of light.

plants.name: Yucca
plants.about: Showing off its sword-like foliage on a broad cane, this plant makes a bold statement. The Yucca plant is a native of Guatemala and southeast Mexico.
plants.water_tips: Yucca is a drought-tolerant plant and does not require much water. Once a week is enough.
plants.light_tips: Will do best in bright indirect light. If the Yucca is exposed to direct light, the leaves may burn. It can tolerate lower light areas but will grow much slower.

plants.name: Zamioculca
plants.about: Originally from the African continent, zamioculca curiously manages to survive very well in little favorable conditions, with scarce water and light.
plants.water_tips: Watering once a week is enough. Because it has a succulent root, similar to a potato, it can store a lot of water and, consequently, withstand dry periods well.
plants.light_tips: Likes half-shade or diffused light and does not tolerate direct sunlight.
